State-run Bharat Heavy Electricals Ltd.'s net profit rose for the April-June quarter, missing street estimates, on higher taxes and other expenses.The company’s net profit grew 3.9 percent to Rs 80.8 crore for the three-month period, according to its stock exchange filing. Analysts tracked by Bloomberg had estimated a profit of Rs 120 crore. Revenue declined 1.5 percent year-on-year to Rs 5,732 crore. This was also below the Rs 6,030 crore estimate.






Segment RevenuePower: Revenue from this segment remained flat at Rs 4,335.63 over the year ago.Industry: Industry revenue fell by Rs 114.3 crore to Rs 1,271.4 crore.






The company reported an operating loss of Rs 88.3 crore compared to an operating income of Rs 70.65 crore in the same quarter last year. Its order book stands at Rs 1 lakh crore.






Shares of the power plant equipment maker fell as much as 4.6 percent intraday to Rs 127, the most in over three months.
title: BHEL’s Q1 Earnings Misses The Mark On Higher Expenses
